oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Feeding chickens fly larvae (Musca domestica) protein improves gut health and performances
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Nordentoft, Steen
Engberg, Ricarda M.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Farming Systems
Animal husbandry
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: In a feeding trial 450 layer chickens were fed either of 3 isoenergetic diets supplemented with different fish meal, grounded fly meal (Musca domestica) or fly meal and fresh fly larvae. The purpose of this study was to investigate the possibility of feeding grounded fly larva to layer chickens as an alternative protein source for fish meal in organic poultry. Parameters investigated were weight gain, food consumption, animal behavior and study whether it would have effect on intestinal health.
oai_dc:dc.dc:identifier: Nordentoft, Steen and Engberg, Ricarda M. (2014) Feeding chickens fly larvae (Musca domestica) protein improves gut health and performances. National Food Institute, Technical University of Denmark.
